Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different types of habitats, such as a garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can draw several kinds of plants that exist in each habitat, like trees, grasses, and flowers.
The student can draw various animals that live in each habitat, such as squirrels, fish, and insects.
The student can demonstrate the diversity of life by comparing the different types of plants and animals in each habitat through drawings.
The student can identify and show patterns in the types of living things that are found in similar habitats.
The student can observe and incorporate details from real life or media examples into their drawings to make comparisons.
The student can document their investigation by organizing and recording their observations in drawings.
